Translation: 从他们自己的历史来看，他们认为这不是一件容易的事情。 他们回忆起他们历史上最伟大的时代，在这些时代中，这些努力是很重要的。骄傲和怀旧的古人们为我们提供了一份礼物。 获得了新技术，

Text: It has been quite the ride.
We communed with the Ancients in our collective dream. They were impressed by our curiosity.
Translation: 我们在集体的梦中与古人交流。我们的好奇心给他们留下了深刻的印象。

Text: Ultimately they expressed understanding, noting that there were times in their own long history, dark times when they had the same hostile response towards the unknown. They hope that with time and maturity we will come to embrace the idea that while the universe is a dangerous place, not everything is a threat and there are also wonders to be discovered. All Black Cubes have disappeared Gained a new Technology,
Translation: 他们最终表达了理解，指出他们自己有悠久的历史，有时候对未知的敌人有相同的敌对反应。 他们希望随着时间推移和发展，我们会接受这样的观点，即虽然宇宙是一个危险的地方，但并非所有事物都是威胁，而且还有奇迹发生。 所有黑色立方体都消失了 获得了新技术，

Text: We communed with the Ancients in our collective dream. They were somewhat surprised by our hostility against the unknown.
Translation: 我们在集体的梦中与古人交流。他们对我们对未知事物的敌意感到有些惊讶。

Text: Oblivious to the concept of higher powers, they seemed to see no other reason for our actions other than a pursuit of aesthetic decoration, one that seems to have eluded them as a possibility. Not quite sure what to make of this, they express hope we will retain our creativity as a race in the ages ahead. The monument collapsed into a pile of Black Cubes Gained a new Technology,
Translation:
对高权力概念的忽视，除了追求审美装饰之外，他们似乎没有其他理由要求我们采取行动，而这似乎并没有将其视为一种可能性。

不知道该怎么做，他们表示希望在未来几年中，我们能够保持我们的势头。

<effect>纪念碑倒塌成一堆黑色立方体
<effect>获得了新技术，<em> <reg_param1> </ em>

Text: We communed with the Ancients in a collective dream. They were impressed by our creativity.
Translation: 我们在集体的梦中与古人交流。他们对我们的创造力印象深刻。

Text:
Meanwhile, reports from all over the Colony indicate that all cubes have ceased their pulsating and reverted to their previous lifeless state. Many Colonists report to the medical facilities that they feel different states of depression – ranging from melancholy to outright despair. Could these events be attributed to the mysterious structure and the death of the cubes? We would never find out.

<effect>All Colonists suffer penalties to Morale.
Translation:
同时，来自各殖民地的报告显示，所有的立方体都已停止搏动并恢复到以前的无生命状态，许多殖民者向医疗机构报告他们感到不同的抑郁状态 - 从忧郁到彻底绝望，可能这些事件归因于神秘的结构和立方体的死亡？我们永远不会知道了。

<effect>所有殖民者都受到对士气的惩罚。

Text: We didn't get to the bottom of the mystery of the Black Cubes. Perhaps more decisive action was needed.
Translation: 我们没有深入到黑色立方体的奥秘之中。 也许需要更果断的行动。

Text: Power of Three: For the Generations to Witness

It would be irresponsible to mismanage the situation and leave public opinion to sway back and forth on the matter.

With the current state of events we lack sufficient data to judge the purpose of the cubes. It could take years if not generations of scientific research to reach a conclusion on that subject. Until then, we will attempt to control the erratic spread of the cubes which hampers our resources and colonization operations by storing them away in a convenient manner.
Translation:
对这种情况进行错误管理并让公众舆论在这个问题上来回摆动是不负责任的。

鉴于目前的事态，我们缺乏足够的数据来判断立方体的用途。 如果不是几代科学研究就此问题达成结论可能需要几年的时间。在此之前，我们将试图通过以方便的方式储存它们，从而控制阻碍我们的资源和殖民化活动的立方体的不稳定传播。

Text: Only time will tell if we are right.
Translation: 只有时间会告诉我们是否正确。

Text: Power of Three: Might Makes Right

We will attempt to remove all the cubes from our immediate area. A decision as serious as this required a consensus, which was reached through a vote at Mission Control. The public may deem this decision wrong, but we cannot place the fate of the entire Colony on our desire to wait it out. History had taught us that the inability to act often results in disaster. The destruction of cubes will proceed as planned.
Translation: 我们将尝试从我们的邻近区域移除所有立方体。像这样严肃的决定需要通过在任务控制部门达成共识。公众可能认为这是个错误的决定，但我们不能把整个殖民地的命运置于等待它的愿望上。历史告诉我们，犹疑不决往往会导致灾难。立方体的破坏将按计划进行。

Text: Humanity will prevail, no matter the cost.
Translation: 无论代价如何，人类都会战胜。

Text: Power of Three: Cult of Tomorrow

To disregard the desires of our Colonists would be a monstrous, autocratic act.

Mission Control has officially allowed the creation of a series of monuments dedicated to the Higher Truth proclaimed by some of our most active Colonists. We must look into ourselves and at our history as a species – denying the possibility that these people are right would mean that we are no better than the fanatics who burned visionaries at the pyres because of their beliefs.
Translation:
无视我们的殖民者的愿望将是一个可怕的专制行为。

任务控制已正式授权建造一系列纪念碑，由我们一些最活跃的殖民者，用于宣布的更高真理。我们必须把自己和我们的历史看作一个类型的 - 否认这些人是对的，可能性意味着我们不会比那些用柴堆烧死信仰先驱的狂热分子好。

Text: It would be tyranny to forbid this.

Translation: 三项之力：奇点迫在眉睫

Text:
The obscure algorithm or – perish the thought! - the intelligence directing the construction has commanded otherwise. Within mere hours, the super-structure dematerialized, decaying to its basic components, and reappeared, commanding our drones to proceed with its construction anew.

The creators of the structure definitely want us to finish their plan. The potential risk from yesterday has now become a tangible menace and I don't believe that anyone in the Colony lives under the illusion that it is avoidable.

<effect>All Colonists suffer Sanity loss due to the threatening behavior of the Mega-Monument Construction.
Translation:
忘了晦涩难懂的算法这个想法！控制住建筑的情报，不然，在短短的几个小时内，超级结构将被去物质化，衰减到其基本组成部分，并再次出现，命令我们的机器人重新进行施工。

结构的创造者绝对希望我们完成他们的计划。 来自昨天的潜在风险现在已经成为一种明显的威胁，我不相信殖民地的任何人都生活在这种可以避免的幻觉之下。

<effect>由于巨型纪念碑建筑的威胁行为，所有殖民者都蒙受了损失。

Text: Ominous news. We must be ready for anything.
Translation: 不祥的消息。我们必须为任何事情做好准备。

Text: Meteors incoming from the Koronis asteroid cluster are about to intercept the Earth and Mars orbits.
Translation: 来自科罗尼斯小行星团的流星即将出现在地球和火星轨道上。

Text: The Dredger that lands excavates something from the planet's surface. Sending an expedition crew to analyze this location will shed light on the Dredgers' behavior.
Translation: 登陆的汲取者从星球表面挖出一些东西。派一名探险队员分析这个位置弄清汲取者的挖了什么。

Text: A Dredger excavated something at this position and then took off. Sending an expedition crew to analyze this location will shed light on the Dredger behavior.
Translation: 汲取者在这个位置挖掘了一些东西，然后起飞。 派遣探险队员分析这个位置将揭示汲取者的遭遇。
汲取者挖掘现场：阿尔法

Text: Send an expedition to observe and examine the landed Dredger to boost our Dredger Morhpology tech
Translation: 派一个探险队观察和检查着陆的汲取者，以提升你的汲取者形态技术

Text:
From the spectroscopic data gathered from afar, we know that the object is covered in a robust crust of silicates and metal despite its organic appearance. The tentacle-like protrusions are inanimate and it seems they serve as support columns for the main structure. The operators reports no activity from the object except its continuous excavation – it is either inanimate or it pays no heed to our presence in the area.

The RC Explorer operator requests permission for close inspection on the object.
Translation:
从远处采集到的光谱数据中，我们知道尽管有机化外观，这个物体仍然覆盖着坚硬的硅酸盐和金属外壳，触手般的突起是无生命的，看起来它们可以作为主体结构的支柱。除了持续的挖掘之外，操作人员不会报告任何活动 - 它无论是无生命的还是不理会我们在该地区的存在。

RC探索者操作员请求对该对象进行详细检查的权限。

Text: Negative. The risk is too high.
The Dredgers: The Belly of the Beast

The rover ventured within mere meters of the Object and conducted a series of field tests and observations on it. We scanned it with radiological and spectroscopic equipment and extended a remote probe to its carapace, gathering tiny samples of its crust. Via its telescopic arm a camera and sonar were inserted within the Object, revealing a perplexing maze of cavities and corridors inside. A close inspection below the Object shows that it digs a hole beneath itself through a rotation of its frontal hull and extracts metal-rich ores, but its position above the ground level remains the same. The RC Explorer operators report no response from the Object during any of these operations.

The data we've gathered is already sent to our sponsor via encrypted transmission. We are sure the commission will value our efforts greatly.

<effect>You've gained <funding(reg_param1)> Funding and <research(reg_param2)>.

<hint>The Object extracts resources from below the surface.
Translation:
漫游者在距离物体仅几米远的地方尝试，并对其进行了一系列现场测试和观测。我们用放射和光谱仪器对其进行了扫描，并将一个远程探测器扩展到了它的甲壳，收集了它的小地壳样本，通过它的伸缩臂，将一个摄像机和一个声纳插入物体内，显露出一个令人困惑的迷宫，里面有空洞和走廊，在物体下方仔细检查表明，它通过旋转其正面船体在其下挖掘出一个洞，并提取富含金属的矿石，但它在地平面以上的位置保持不变。在这些操作中，RC探索者操作员报告没有来自对象的响应。

我们收集的数据已经通过加密传输发送给我们的赞助商。我们相信该委员会将会极大地重视我们的努力。

<effect>您已获得 <funding(reg_param1)>资助和 <research(reg_param2)>。

<提示>对象从表面下方提取资源。
幸运总是眷顾勇敢的人

Text:
The RC Explorer ventured within mere meters of the Object and conducted series of field tests and observations on it. The operators scanned the Object with radiological and spectroscopic equipment and extended a remote probe to its carapace, gathering tiny samples of its crust. When the RC Explorer approached the Object to perform closer interaction with it via the telescopic arms, the digging process of the Object caused a minor crust collapse and it nearly smashed the front of the rover’s hull. This didn't appear to be a deliberate attack but the damage is evident – it seems the Object possesses immense strength as well.

Despite our setbacks we gathered important data and have already sent it to our sponsor via encrypted transmission. We are sure the commission will value our efforts greatly.

<effect>You've gained <funding(reg_param1)> Funding. The RC Explorer suffered a malfunction.

<hint>The Object extracted resources from below the surface.
Translation:
RC探索者在距离物体仅几米远的范围内进行了尝试，并对其进行了一系列现场测试和观测，操作人员使用放射性和光谱设备扫描了物体，并将一个远程探针延伸到了它的甲壳体内，收集了它的微小地壳样本。RC探索者通过伸缩臂与物体接近，通过物体的挖掘过程造成轻微的地壳塌陷，几乎砸毁了船体的前部，这似乎不是故意的攻击，而损害是显而易见的 - 看起来对象也具有巨大的优势。

尽管我们遇到挫折，但我们收集了重要数据，并已通过加密传输将其发送给我们的赞助商。我们相信该委员会将会极大地重视我们的努力。

<effect>您已获得 <funding(reg_param1)> 资金。 RC探索者发生故障。

<hint>对象从表面下方提取资源。

Text: We knew the risks but it was worth it.
Translation: 我们知道风险，但这是值得的。

Text:
The RC Explorer will be returning to base soon. Meanwhile, we will continue to gather visual and telemetry data on the object. The data we've gathered is already sent to our sponsor via encrypted transmission. We are sure the commission will value our efforts greatly.

<effect>You receive <funding(reg_param1)> Funding.

<hint>The Object extracted metals from below the surface.
Translation:
RC探索者将很快返回基地。同时，我们将继续收集有关目标的图像和遥测数据。我们收集的数据已经通过加密传输发送给我们的赞助商，我们相信该委员会将重视我们的 努力。

<effect>您收到 <funding(reg_param1)> 资金。

<hint>物体从表面下方提取金属。

Text:
The large hole left behind by the Object was the focus of the expedition, and the RC Explorer operators did their best to scavenge every bit of information left behind. With the help of the its telescopic arms and on-board spectroscopic equipment, the RC Explorer helped us find out that the hole was dug up on top of a subsurface resource deposit. The amount of discarded waste rock as well as the volume of the hole suggested that the Object sifted through the soil and took away only the usable bits. What the purpose of this was is unknown.

<hint>The Object extracted resources from below the surface and took off with them
Translation:
物体留下的大洞是探险的焦点，而且RC探索者的操作人员尽其所能清除遗留下来的各种信息，借助其伸缩臂和车载光谱设备，RC探索者帮助我们发现，这个洞是在地下资源矿床的顶部挖出来的，废弃的废石量和洞的体积表明这个物体在土壤中只能拿走可用的泥土。目的是未知的。

<hint>对象从表面以下抽取资源并与它们一起取出

Text: This only makes the mystery deeper.

Translation: 汲取者：一个奇怪的观察

Text:
The RC Explorer used molecular spectroscopy to scan the Rubidium-Strontium proportions on the outer shell of the Dredger and the results are astonishing! It seems that the outer shell of the Dredger is extremely new, as if it has been created years ago!

Some of our scientists proposed that the Dredgers must originate from our Solar System, unless they can traverse immense distances in a flash.

<effect>The Dredger Morphology technology receives a 50% Boost.
Translation:
RC探索者使用分子光谱仪扫描汲取者外壳上的铷 - 锶比例，结果令人吃惊！看起来，汲取者的外壳是崭新的，就和它多年前做出来时一样！

我们的一些科学家提出，汲取者必须来自我们的太阳系，除非他们能瞬间穿越巨大的距离。

<effect>汲取者形态学技术获得50％的提升。

Text: If this is true, how could we have missed them for so long?
Translation: 如果这是真的，我们怎么会失去他们这么久？

Text:
The expedition leader took the initiative to make physical contact with the landed Dredger. Risking it, he ordered the RC Explorer to approach the imposing alien object with a sampling tool and scrape off a portion of its outer hull, nervously anticipating a hostile reaction. The Dredger did nothing, so the RC Explorer ventured closer to it, taking more samples of its hull and probing its insides with various scanning equipment.

It is now evident that the outer shell of the Dredger consists of silicates and heavy inert metals with no traces of organic materials. The inner walls of the jet vents contain traces of burned alkaline metals. Some of our scientists propose that they are the fuel used to propel the Dredger during flight and take-off.

The object demonstrated no interest in the activities of the rover. The scientists speculate that it lacks any sort of sensors or processing power whatsoever.

<effect>The Dredger Morphology technology receives a 50% Boost.
Translation:
探险队的领队主动与着陆的汲取者进行了仔细检查，他命令RC探索者用取样工具接近这个气势磅礴的外星物体，并刮掉其外壳的一部分，紧张地猜测着有什么敌对的反应。汲取者没有任何反应，所以RC探索者更接近它，采集更多的船体样本，并用各种扫描设备探测其内部。

现在很明显，汲取者的外壳由硅酸盐和重惰性金属组成，没有痕量有机物质。喷口的内壁含有痕量的碱性金属。我们的一些科学家提出，他们是在飞行和起飞期间用来推进汲取者的燃料。

该物体对漫游者的活动没有兴趣。科学家们推测，它缺乏任何传感器或处理能力。

<effect>汲取者形态学技术获得50％的提升。

Text: So we are talking about a machine or a very primitive organism? Maybe both?
Translation: 那么我们是在谈论一台机器还是一个非常原始的有机体？或者两个都是？

Text:
After our operators made their brave approach and even touched the previous Dredger, no one feels intimidated by the large alien landers. The RC Explorer operators have even begun nicknaming the Dredgers with cute names such as Big Betty. While this raises the morale of the Colony, the scientists are excited to work with the large inflow of samples and data.

<effect>Dredger Morphology technology receives a 50% Boost.
Translation:
在我们的操作员勇敢的启动了之前的汲取者之后，没有人会对大型外星登陆者感到恐惧，RC探索者的操作员甚至开始给汲取者起了个可爱的名字比如Big Betty，这会提高殖民地的士气。在殖民地，科学家们兴奋地处理大量的样本和数据。

<effect>汲取者形态学技术获得50％的提升。

Text: Name one Cthulhu just for me, OK?
Translation: 我给它命名克苏鲁，怎么样？

Text:
The spectacular explosion revealed that the Dredger lacks mechanical components, its warped internal components resembling organs more than devices. The mysteries behind such a technology have already inspired some of our greatest minds. The Head Scientist called this the project of the century and one can clearly hear the excitement in his voice.

<effect>The Dredger Wavelength Decoding receives a 50% Boost
Translation:
这次壮观的爆炸表明，汲取者缺乏机械部件，其翘曲的内部组件比器件更类似于器官，这种技术背后的奥秘已经鼓舞了我们的科学家，他们的头称这是世纪的计划，我能清楚地听到他的声音中带着激动。

<effect>撒粉器波长解码接收50％升压

Text:
More samples would allow our scientists to apply more aggressive experimentation and analytical methods, speeding up their work immensely.

<effect>The Dredger Wavelength Decoding receives a 50% Boost
Translation:
更多的样本可以让我们的科学家应用到更积极的实验和分析方法里，极大地加速他们的工作。

<effect>撒粉器波长解码接收50％升压

Text:
Several hours ago, the LINEAR and CSS programs detected an incoming cluster of meteorites from the asteroid belt. Their trajectories are likely to converge with the Martian orbit. Meteor impacts are likely to intensify during the course of the next few weeks.

<effect>Expect several Meteor Storms to hit Mars in the next <text_param1> Sols.
Translation:
几小时前，LINEAR和CSS项目组发现了来自小行星带的陨石群，它们的轨迹很可能与火星轨道重合，在接下来的几周内流星的影响可能会加剧。

<effect>预计在下 <text_param1> 日后会有几个流星暴击中火星。

Text: All personnel – keep calm and watch for meteors.
Translation: 所有人员 - 保持冷静并留意流星。

Text:
The initial evaluation of the situation with the meteor clusters had been miscalculated. The scientists from the near-Earth object detection programs predict that a significant amount of the meteorite stream would fill the space between Mars and Earth. While the thick atmosphere of our home world would protect it from eventual impacts, the threat level for any spacecraft will be past tolerable. To address the new situation, Earth Control has canceled all space flights until further notice.

<effect>Rockets will not arrive until the situation with the meteor impacts is resolved. Inbound rockets will still land on Mars.
Translation:
对流星团状况的初步评估有些错误，来自近地天体探测计划的科学家预测，大量的陨石流将填补火星与地球之间的空间。而我们家乡的浓厚大气将会保护它免受最终的影响，任何航天器的威胁水平都将是可以忍受的。为了解决这个新情况，地球控制已经取消了所有太空飞行，直到另行通知。

<effect>直到流星撞击事件得到解决，火箭才会到达。入境火箭仍将登陆火星。

Text: We must maintain strict regulations over our supplies until then.
Translation: 我们必须对我们的供给品严格控制，直到恢复的时候。

Text: Severe meteor activity is preventing interplanetary travel. Rockets cannot be requested from Earth.
Translation: 严重的流星活动妨碍了星际旅行。不能从地球上请求发射火箭了。

Text:
Mission Control, our sensors are detecting a large object incoming at high velocity. Judging by the data from our telemetry, its mass and speed are great enough to cause major damage on the surface. It would be wise to evacuate the area around the projected point of impact.

We could be wrong, but our initial visual readings on the object show that it has an unconventional form for a meteorite. Strange protrusions can be observed from the back of the object. Could this be something different than a meteor?

<effect>A major impact is expected to happen somewhere on Mars.
Translation:
任务控制，我们的传感器检测到高速飞来的大物体，根据我们的遥测数据判断，它的质量和速度足以造成表面的重大损坏，撤离投影周围区域是明智的做法。

我们可能是错的，但是我们最初对物体的视觉读数表明它是个非常规的陨石。可以从物体背面观察到奇怪的突起。这可能与流星不同吗？

<effect>预计火星的某个地方会产生重大影响。

Text: Stay focused and don’t jump to conclusions.
We haven't seen anything like it – and it doesn't look like something man made. I don't want to overstate things, but this could be a First Contact situation.
Translation: 我们还从未见过这样的东西 - 它看起来不像人造的。我不想夸大事实，但这可能是我们的第一次接触。

Text: Let’s see what we can see.
Translation: 让我们看看我们能看到什么。

Text:
The object hit the surface without decelerating. We expected it to burst into pieces from the force of impact, but it seems it possesses immense structural integrity. The most astonishing thing is that it has moving parts. From what we have observed so far, it seems that it is trying to burrow below the crust of the planet.

It is now or never to take a closer look – should the risk be worth it.

<effect>An Anomaly at the landing site is available for analysis.
Translation:
物体撞击表面没有减速，我们预计它会由于撞击力而破裂，但它似乎具有巨大的结构完整性，最令人惊讶的是它具有可移动的部件，从我们迄今观察到的情况来看， 它似乎正在试图在地壳上挖洞。

过了这村就没这个店了，仔细观察 - 值得冒个险。

<effect>着陆点的异常现象可供分析。

Text: Maintain safe distance and stand by for further orders.
Translation: 保持安全距离并等待下一步指示。

Text: A mysterious alien object has landed on Mars and is excavating resources. We have to send an Expedition to investigate it on site.
Translation: 一个神秘的外星物体落在火星上，正在挖掘资源。我们必须派遣远征队在现场进行调查。

Text:
As abruptly as it came, the object took off and accelerated extremely quickly. Our initial predictions that it would dig itself deeper in the crust have proven wrong. Instead, from our observation on the landing site, we can conclude that a large amount of Martian soil had been removed and taken away. What the goal and the purpose of this operation was is unknown.

<effect>The object has taken off.
Translation:
随着它的到来，物体起飞并迅速加速。我们最初预测它会在地壳中深入地下，这被证明是错误的，相反，从我们在着陆点观察，我们可以得出结论：大量的火星土壤已经被移走并被带走，这次行动的意图不明。

<effect>物体已经起飞。

Text: Watch the skies – something tells me there will be more of this.
Translation: 抬头看看天 - 我觉得会有更多这样的事情。

Text: The mysterious alien codenamed Dredger has taken off.
Translation: 代号为“汲取者”的神秘外星已经起飞。

Text: The Dredgers: They Will Be Back

The similarities with the first Object are obvious, but we cannot confirm the identity on the new one. Our scientists speculate that it would land in another mineral rich region. Our sponsor suggests that we maintain visual contact with the Object but keep our distance as its intentions or its defensive capabilities are unknown.

Our sponsor’s contacts on Earth rifled through any data for a mission launched by another competitor on Earth, but from what we have seen so far it wouldn’t be far-fetched to suggest that these Objects are of extraterrestrial origin.

By the way, the sponsor HQ dubbed the Object Dredger and they require us to maintain coherency in our documentation by using the same call-sign.

<effect>A new Dredger is about to land on Mars.
Translation:
与第一个物体的相似之处是显而易见的，但我们无法证实新物体的身份。我们的科学家推测它会落在另一个矿物质丰富的地区，我们的赞助商建议我们保持与物体的视觉接触，但保持距离，其意图或其防御能力未知。
我们的赞助者在地球上的联系人通过数据来查找是否是地球上其他竞争对手在发起的任务。但从目前为止我们所看到的，这些对象都是来自外星的，虽然不意味着什么。
顺便说一下，赞助商HQ将其称为“物体汲取者”，并要求我们通过使用相同的呼号来保持文件的一致性。

<effect>一艘新的汲取者即将登陆火星。

Text: Whatever they call it, it’s still our problem.
Translation: 无论他们怎么称呼它，它仍然是我们的问题。

Text: More Dredgers continue to land on Mars in search of resources.
Translation: 更多汲取者继续登陆火星寻找资源。

Text:
This happened after our sponsor's council reviewed our report on the Dredgers. With the current development, we know that more and more Dredgers land on Mars to extract large amounts of subsurface metals which, combined with the ban on space flights, would endanger the future of the Colony. Our observations on the Dredgers' flight trajectories indicate that they are heading exclusively to Mars and that the threat for interplanetary vessels has lessened, which was confirmed by the CSS and LINEAR.

<effect>Rockets can travel between Mars and Earth once more.
Translation:
这件事发生在我们的赞助商理事会审查了我们关于汲取者的报告之后，随着目前的发展，我们知道越来越多的汲取者在火星上着陆以提取大量的地下金属，再加上禁止太空飞行将危及殖民地的未来。我们对汲取者的飞行轨迹的观察表明，它们专门用于火星，星际舰船的威胁已经减弱，这已经被CSS和LINEAR所证实。
<effect>火箭可以再次在火星和地球之间旅行。

Text: The ban on interplanetary flights was lifted. We can now request help from Earth.
Translation: 星际航线恢复了，我们现在可以向地球寻求帮助。

Text:
The problem is the lack of information – so far, we know very little about the nature of the Dredgers. To us they appear as inscrutable as natural events were to our forefathers. The science team requests more data on the objects and, if possible, a closer inspection of several different targets.

<effect>New Research available: Dredger Morphology

<hint>You can boost your Technology Research rate by analyzing landed Dredgers.
Translation:
问题是缺乏信息 - 到目前为止，我们对汲取者的情况知之甚少。对我们来说，它们就像我们的祖先看待自然现象一样不可思议。科学团队要求更多有关物体的数据，如果可能的话，仔细检查几个不同的目标。

<effect>新研究可用：汲取者形态学

<hint>您可以通过分析登陆的汲取者来提高您的技术研发率。

Text: Scientists are working on a project to analyze the structure of the Dredgers. Expeditions near landed Dredgers will help their effort.
Translation: 科学家正在研究一个分析汲取者的结构项目。靠近地面汲取者的探险将有助于他们的努力。

Text: The council of our sponsor has authorized us to use force when dealing with the Dredgers. They put the future of the Colony as the utmost priority.
Translation: 我们的赞助商理事会授权我们处理汲取者时使用武力。他们把殖民地的未来作为最重要的优先事项。

Text: It’s comforting to know that our actions have political backing.
Translation: 知道我们的行动有政治支持，这很让人欣慰。
汲取者：科罗尼斯的困境

Text:
This occasional discovery was made later rather than sooner, as the emissions are cleverly masked to resemble cosmic rays in their wavelength. It is apparent that the source of the landers is closer than we thought.

The science team immediately requested permission to “dissect” one of the Dredgers to get their hands on the mysterious device used to send these transmissions.

<effect>A new research is available – Dredger Wavelength Decoding.

<hint>Destroy Dredgers using Drones to gain a Tech Boost towards the Technology’s progress.
Translation:
这个偶然的发现是发生在后来而不是早些时候，因为这些发射以类似于宇宙射线的波长，巧妙地掩盖起来。很明显，着陆器的来源比我们想象的要近。
科学小组立即要求允许“剖析”其中一艘汲取者，以获取用于发送这些传输的神秘设备。

<effect>有一项新的研究 - 挖泥机波长解码。

<hint>使用无人驾驶飞机摧毁汲取者以获得技术上的进步。

Text: Time to stop whistling in the dark.
Translation: 是时候停止在黑暗中呼啸了。

Text: Scientists are working on a project to decode the communications used by the Dredgers. Expeditions to the locations of destroyed Dredgers will help their effort.
Translation: 科学家们正在研究一个项目来解码汲取者所使用的通讯。考察被毁坏的汲取者的位置将有助于他们的努力。

Text:
Still, what started out as a single contact quickly grew into series of regular visits. Even when our “guests” are not blaster-toting gray men, they cause damage to our Colony in subtle and cruel ways. As more and more Dredgers continue to land on the surface, the future of the Colony could be threatened by the lack of sufficient metallic resources. It is a sad conclusion, but our first contact with alien life could turn into a race for survival.

Our scientists suggest that with the current rate of landings the amount of metals in our sector will be depleted within three years – and some of the most pessimistic of our colleagues believe that the trend is for the landings to become more frequent. This would be a terrible prospect.
Translation:
尽管如此，作为单一联系人开始的事情很快就成了一系列定期访问，即使我们的”客人“不是灰色背心的人，也会以微妙而残酷的方式对我们的殖民地造成损害。随着越来越多的汲取者继续登录，从表面上看，殖民地的未来可能会因缺乏足够的金属资源而受到威胁，这是一个可悲的结论，但我们与外星生命的第一次接触可能会变成一场生存竞赛。
我们的科学家认为，按照目前的登陆速度，我们部门的金属量将在三年内耗尽 - 而且我们的同事中最悲观的一些人认为趋势是登陆更加频繁。这将是一个可怕的前景。

Text: Arrange a team meeting – we have to work out a solution.
Translation: 安排一次团队会议 - 我们必须制定一个解决方案。

Text:
A famous leaks site has just released leaked logs and reports from our Colony. They concentrate exclusively on the Dredgers and elaborate on the evidence that we have contacted an alien civilization.

Our sponsors were probably foolish enough to believe that a secret can remain hidden from the public in the Age of Information. The uproar is tremendous and the UN calls for an emergency press conference. The monitoring council of our sponsor was insistent on our participation in the event. It will be held via the interplanetary network. We’ll be the center of attention. The time-lag will give us fifteen minutes between questions to think of the best way to answer.

There is no reason to hide the truth now.
Translation:
一个著名的泄密网站刚刚发布了来自我们的殖民地的泄露日志和报告，他们专注于汲取者并详细说明我们已经联系了外来文明的证据。
我们的赞助商可能愚蠢到相信在信息时代秘密会对公众隐瞒。骚动非常激烈，联合国呼吁召开紧急新闻发布会。我们赞助商的监督委员会坚持参加这次活动。它将通过星际网络举行。我们将成为关注的中心。传输时差会给我们15分钟的时间来思考问题的最佳答案。
现在没有理由隐瞒真相了。

Text: A hearing on the Dredgers matters and a press conference at the United Nations Assembly will be held soon.
Translation: 联合国大会将举行关于汲取者问题的听证会和新闻发布会。

Text:
Mr. President; Mr. Secretary General; fellow delegates; ladies and gentlemen:

For many centuries, humans have speculated that, in the great expanse of the universe, there should be life. Humanity never dismissed their hope for contact and so, even before we could reach for the stars, we built machines to probe the space for signs of the existence of others. Until recently, our attempts were met with silence and we had to rely only on our unshakable belief. But today we have proof. We are not alone.

Allow me to introduce you to the Commander of Mars Alpha, our first Colony on the Red Planet, who will personally address your questions.
Translation:
总统先生，秘书长先生，各位代表，女士们，先生们：
数百年来，人类推测，在宇宙的浩瀚中，应该有其他生命。人类从不否认他们接触的希望，因此，即使在我们接触星星之前，我们也建造了机器来探测空间，寻找其他人存在的迹象。直到最近，我们的努力都是沉默的，我们不得不依靠我们不可动摇的信念。但今天我们有证据，我们并不孤单。
请允许我向你们介绍我们在红色星球上的第一个殖民地Mars Alpha的指挥官，他将亲自回答你们的问题。

Text: We can’t speak to contact or conflict, but rather about unforeseen competition...
Translation: 我们不能说接触或冲突，而是谈论无法预料的竞争......

Text: To talk about making contact with a sentient race is rather premature...
Translation: 谈论与有感知力的种族接触还为时尚早...

Text: The Dredgers: Press Conference: The Race is On
Translation: 汲取者：新闻发布会：比赛已经开始

Text:
The vessels dismissed all of our attempts to communicate and proceeded with their only mission – to consume and transport resources from the surface of Mars. In another time we would address their activity with affectionate curiosity and excitement, but in the light of our current situation, this has caused great distress and concern in all personnel of Mars Alpha. Without bothering you with the tiresome technical details, the extraction and utilization of Martian resources is crucial to the success of Mars Alpha and our ability to settle in the Solar System.

Our Colony's safety and viability is our utmost priority. This is why I’ve personally supervised operations to deny the alien vessels the opportunity to extract and steal away the metal deposits crucial to our survival. I would ask those who might raise questions on the measure of our reaction – what do you call a neighbor who deliberately tries to stall your attempts to lead a better life?
Translation:
这些船只驳斥了我们所有的沟通尝试，并继续完成他们唯一的使命 - 从火星表面挖掘和运输资源。还有，我们会以深切的好奇心和兴奋来研究他们的活动，但鉴于目前的情况，这已经给Mars Alpha的所有人员带来了极大的困扰和关注，在不打扰您繁琐的技术细节的情况下，火星资源的提取和利用对Mars Alpha的成功和我们在太阳系中的定居能力至关重要。
我们的殖民地的安全性和可行性是我们的最高优先事项。 这就是为什么我亲自监督行动，否认外星船只有机会提取和偷走对我们生存至关重要的金属矿藏。我会问那些可能就我们的反应措施提出问题的人 - 你怎么称呼邻居故意试图阻止你过上更好的生活？

Text: The Dredgers: Press Conference: Contact Denied
Translation: 汲取者：新闻发布会：沟通被拒绝

Text:
At their core of our expectations has always been a flawed assumption – that an alien race would be psychologically human.

The first contact, if one has the audacity to call it that way, was with a system of automated mining equipment. As disappointing as it may sound, the alien machines displayed an almost offensive disregard for our presence. So far they had followed their simple purpose – to extract resources from the surface of Mars. The nature and intentions of their creators remains a mystery and our best minds are working towards unveiling it.
Translation:
我们核心的期望一直是一个有缺陷的假设 - 外星人种族将是心理上的人类。
第一次接触，如果有人敢这么叫，那就是采用自动采矿设备系统。 虽然听起来令人失望，但外星人的机器几乎无视我们的存在。到目前为止，他们已经遵循了他们的简单目的 - 从火星表面提取资源。他们的创作者的本质和意图仍然是一个谜，我们最好的头脑正在努力研究它。

Text: The Dredgers: Press Conference - Hard Questions
Translation: 汲取者：新闻发布会 - 难题

Text:
They handle most of the questions with ease and require little input from you. And then you are confronted with a direct question from one of the delegates.

“An anonymous yet reliable source disclosed to us that you ordered and succeeded in the deliberate destruction of at least one of the alien vessels. My country condemns any premature aggressive actions which could taint the reputation of humankind, especially when addressing such a delicate matter. What gave you the authority to act in such a risky manner without an official resolution from the Council of the United Nations?”
Translation:
他们很轻松地处理了大部分问题，并且只需要您很少的参与，然后您就会面临来自其中一位代表的直接问题。
“一位可靠的匿名消息人士向我们透露，你命令并成功地蓄意破坏至少一艘外星船只。 我国谴责任何可能玷污人类声誉的过早的侵略行为，特别是在处理这种微妙问题时。 谁给你的权力，在没有联合国理事会正式决议的情况下采取如此冒险的行动？”

Text: The prosperity of our Colony is our first and only concern...
Translation: 我们殖民地的繁荣是我们首要也是唯一的关注点...

Text: This is not an act of aggression but instead a step towards mutual understanding...
Translation: 这不是一种侵略行为，而是相互理解的一步...

Text: The Dredgers: Press Conference – United We Stand
Translation: 汲取者：新闻发布会 - 我们团结在一起

Text:
For countless generations the human species had proven to possess the ability to adapt, survive and thrive. Let us not forget who we are.

The actions I ordered were not an act of war and aggression, but instead were means to secure the future of our initiative and fulfill a promise to all people on Earth. Dismantling several alien vessels is a fair price to pay for what's at stake today. And if the creators of these vessels see our actions as something more than doing the right thing, we will prove them wrong. For we do not desire to take what's not ours – we want to fulfill our destiny as a space-faring species.
Translation:
对于无数代人来说，人类已经证明其具备适应，生存和发展的能力，让我们不要忘记我们是谁。我下令采取的行动不是战争和侵略行为，而是确保我们未来主动行动的手段，并履行对地球上所有人的承诺。 
在这种利害关系下，拆除几艘外星船只是一个公平的代价。如果这些船只的创造者认为我们的行为不正确，我们将证明他们是错误的。对那些不希望我们获得应属于我们的物种来说 - 我们希望实现我们作为太空飞行物种的命运

Text: The Dredgers: Press Conference – A Battle Well Fought
Translation: 汲取者：新闻发布会 - 战斗很好战斗

Text:
You not only managed to persuade the public to support our efforts, but also inspired millions of people around the world who watched the live-stream.

Your influence will aid the Colony greatly.

<effect>The United Nations transferred resources to the Mars Alpha project. You've gained <funding(reg_param1)> Funding.
Translation:
你不仅设法说服公众支持我们的努力，还激励了全球数百万观看现场直播的人。
你的影响力将极大地帮助殖民地。
<effect>联合国将转移资源到Mars Alpha项目。您已获得 <funding(reg_param1)> 的资金。

Text: I'm glad the UN understood the importance of our mission.
Translation: 我很高兴联合国明白我们使命的重要性。

Text: The United Nations were persuaded to support the Colony with increased funding.
Translation: 联合国被说服以增加资金支持殖民地。

Text: Press Conference 2: A Bridge to Build

Our goal was to make sense of what's happening, of the nature of the alien vessels, which is one of the underlying principles of science.

Our efforts were not in vain. The greatest minds of Mars Alpha and Earth managed to make amazing progress. Dismantling the probe allowed us to make sense of the communications of the alien machines, maybe even the basis of the language of their creators, and not only that. The scientific knowledge we gained from this event will speed our way to the stars, where even more puzzling mysteries await those of us who have the bravery and integrity to face the unknown.
Translation:
我们的目标是理解发生的事情，还有外星船的情况，这是科学的基本原理之一。
我们的努力并不是徒劳的。Mars Alpha和地球的伟大的想法取得惊人的进展。拆除探针使我们能够理解外星人机器的通信，甚至可能是其创作者语言的基础。不仅仅是这些，我们从这次活动中获得的科学知识将加速我们走向群星之路。在那里，更令人困惑的未知奥秘正等待着勇敢和正直的人去面对。

Text:
You not only managed to persuade the public to support our efforts, but also inspired millions of people around the world who watched the live-stream.

Your influence will aid the Colony greatly.

<effect> Public opinion for Mars Alpha increased. Additional <reg_param1> Applicants are available.
Translation:
您不仅设法说服公众支持我们的努力，还激励了全球数百万观看现场直播的人。
你的影响力将极大地帮助殖民地。
<effect> Mars Alpha的舆论支持增加。其他 <reg_param1> 申请人可用。

Text: I feel like a rock star.
Millions of people on Earth were inspired by the press-conference and more and more Applicants are willing to colonize Mars.
Translation: 地球上数以百万计的人受到新闻发布会的启发，越来越多的人愿意申请殖民火星。

Text:
The scanners have gone crazy with the signatures of dozens of Dredgers heading our way. The Dredger transmissions repeat a signal we can interpret only as “urgency eat/dig”. On the screen they look like a swarm of locusts and we presume their goal is similar.
The mission sponsor has authorized a forceful response.

<effect>Multiple Dredgers detected! They will arrive within <text_param1> Sols.
Translation:
扫描仪疯狂的接收到了数十艘汲取者的信号，汲取者传输着一个重复信号，我们可以将其解释为“紧急吃/挖”，在屏幕上它们看起来像一群蝗虫，我们假设他们的目标都一样。
特派团发起人已授权作出有力回应。
<effect>检测到多个汲取者！ 他们将在 <text_param1> 日内到达。

Text: Multiple Dredgers are bound to land on Mars and harvest our resources!
Translation: 多艘汲取者降落在火星上并收获我们的资源！
汲取者：黑暗的天空 - 汇报

Text:
As sudden as they fell upon us, the alien vessels are taking off all at once. Our scientists are just starting to estimate the exact amount of precious resources that have been irreparably lost, but the preliminary reports are promising. We've survived!

Pleased with our performance, the monitoring council of our sponsor offered us their financial support as a stimulus.

<effect>You destroyed <reg_param1> Dredgers during the mass landing. Based on the Dredgers destroyed, the mission sponsor provided a bounty of <funding(reg_param2)> Funding.
Translation:
当他们刚开始出现时，外星船只来了就走。我们的科学家们开始估算已经失去的宝贵资源的数量，但初步报告是有希望的，我们幸存下来！
对我们的表现感到满意，我们赞助商的监督委员会为我们提供了财政支持作为刺激。
<effect>你在海上登陆过程中摧毁了 <reg_param1> 汲取者。基于毁坏的汲取者，特派团赞助商提供了一笔 <funding(reg_param2)> 资金。

Text: We’ll do it again if we have to!
Translation: 如果必须的话，我们会再做一次！

Text:
As sudden as they fell upon us, the alien vessels are taking off all at once. Our scientists estimate they extracted a significant amount of materials from below the surface. This is a serious threat to the viability of our Colony and the monitoring council of our sponsor took that in mind. They offered us a small sum as a disaster relief, but from the subtle remarks in their message we can tell they are not happy with the situation.

<effect>You've gained <funding(reg_param1)> Funding as disaster relief.
Translation:
我们的科学家们估算了他们从地表下提取物质的数量，足以对我们的殖民地和监测委员会的生存构成了严重的威胁。我们的赞助者了解到这一点，为我们提供了一小笔救灾款项，但从他们信息中的微妙传递了他们对这种情况的不满。
<effect>您已获得 <funding(reg_param1)> 资金用于救灾。

Text: We have survived the Dredger invasion. Teams are working on evaluating the damage.
Translation: 我们在汲取者入侵中幸存下来，团队正在努力评估损失。

Text:
Our readings confirm that this is a Dredger, but its size... There is no mistake, unfortunately.

If we leave this massive Dredger unchecked, it could have a disastrous impact on our metal supply. On the other hand, our Tactical Advisor supposes that the arrival of this new Dredger may be caused by the threat our actions proved for the aliens' mining operations. At the end, the decision as to how we address the new situation was obvious.

Just when we thought we survived the worst...

<effect>A huge Dredger will land on Mars in <text_param1> Sols.

<hint>You can dismantle the incoming Dredger using Drones.
Translation:
我们的读数证实这是一艘汲取者，但它的大小...不幸的是读数并没错。
如果我们放弃这艘大型汲取者，可能会对我们的金属供应产生灾难性影响。另一方面，我们的战术顾问认为，这艘新型汲取者的到来，可能是由于我们的行动威胁到外星人的采矿作业所致。现在很显然，我们要决定如何应对新形势了。
就在我们认为我们幸免于难的时候...
<effect>一艘巨大的汲取者将在 <text_param1> 日登陆火星。
<hint>你可以使用无人驾驶飞机拆除传入的汲取者。

Text: A massive Dredger is inbound to land on Mars.
Translation: 一艘大型汲取者登陆火星。

Text: The Dredgers – Conclusion: Fires of Tomorrow's Dawn
Translation: 汲取者 - 结论：明日黎明之火

Text: The comm-feed from the dying Dredger report a singular message broadcast towards the Koronis cluster – “retreat”, “retreat”. Others may wonder, but you know deep inside that you beheaded the beast – the other Dredgers won't be coming back. Somehow you don't feel like the victor. You stand silent as you ask yourself one question – have you defeated a dangerous enemy or rebuffed a potential ally? Xeno-Extraction Technology is available for research with a 100% Boost Gained a new technology,
Translation: 垂死的汲取者向科罗尼斯星群发送了一个单独的通讯消息 - “撤退”，“撤退”。其他人可能会想，但你的内心深处知道，你已经击败了它们 - 其他的汲取者不会再来了。 不知何故，你不觉得自己是胜利者。一个问题使你陷入了沉思 - 你打败了一个危险的敌人，还是拒绝了一个潜在的盟友？ 异种萃取技术的研究提高至100％ 获得了一项新技术，
只有时间能告诉我们答案。

Text: We have destroyed the massive Dredger and salvaged samples and information on its unique excavation methods – Xeno-Extraction Tech is now available. The alien vessels are gone forever.
Translation: 我们已经摧毁了大量的汲取者并抢救了样品，以及提供了其独特挖掘方法的信息 - 异种萃取技术现已上市。外星船只一去不复返。
汲取者 - 结论：十字路口

Text: The cheerful chorus of the Dredger communications is too confusing to understand, but this is pointless as their behavior clearly marks their intentions. The visual feed on the Koronis cluster shows how thousands of bright dots light the sky as the swarm of Dredgers breaks its silence. The satellites track their movement as the swarm gathers around the massive Dredger and the alien vessels head towards the end of the Solar System. You failed to destroy the massive Dredger and the Colony will pay the price in the months to come, but maybe this is for the better. Maybe today humanity avoided retribution from the unknown creators of the Dredgers, or started on the path of cooperation, and maybe even friendship, when the next generations reach the stars. Xeno-Extraction Technology is available for research Gained a new technology,
Translation: 汲取者的通讯欢快混乱而且无法理解，但这毫无意义，因为他们的行为清楚地表明了他们的意图。科罗尼斯星群上的视觉反馈显示了汲取者群打破沉默时数千个亮点照亮了天空，卫星监测到它们群聚在大型汲取者周围朝向太阳系末端飞走。 你未能摧毁大型汲取者，殖民地将在未来几个月付出代价，也许这样好些吧。也许今天的人类避免了汲取者的未知创造者的报复，或者开始走上合作的道路，甚至我们下一代到达群星时能获得友谊。 异种萃取技术可用于研究 获得了一项新技术，

Text: The massive Dredger has taken off and converged with the alien fleet on a course leading far from the Solar System. They’ve left forever. We now have the Xeno-Extraction Tech project based on what we know about the Dredgers.
Translation: 这艘大型汲取者起飞并在远离太阳系的路线上与外星舰队融合。他们永远离开了。我们现在拥有基于我们所了解的汲取者的异种萃取术项目。

Text:
The scientists concluded that the organic appearance of the Dredgers is misleading. Even though their robust hulls are made to endure extreme impact forces, they are deprived of any sensors and react in no way to changes in their environment. Simply put, they are nothing more than extraction vehicles with simple programming.

Here comes the best part – the Dredgers are quite vulnerable! The alkaloid fuels they utilize for propulsion makes them highly volatile in oxygen-rich atmospheres. This is probably the reason why no Dredger landed on Earth so far.
It is a tough decision whether we should use force against the Dredgers.

<effect>You can now use Drones to destroy Dredgers
Translation:
科学家们得出结论，汲取者的有机外表误导了我们。即使它们坚固的船体能够承受极端的冲击力，但它们被剥夺了所有传感器和对环境的反应能力。他们无非就是简单编程的萃取车辆。
最好的部分是 - 汲取者非常脆弱！它们用于推进的生物碱燃料在富氧环境中具有高度挥发性。这可能是目前到为止没有汲取者在地球上着陆的原因。我们是否应该对汲取者使用武力是一个艰难的决定。
<effect>你现在可以使用机器人来摧毁汲取者

Text: Hostilities should be our last resort.
Translation: 敌对行动应该是我们的最后手段。

Text: They came uninvited and I believe it is our right to defend what is ours.
Translation: 他们不请自来，我相信我们有权捍卫我们的东西。

Text: We have researched a way to destroy landed Dredgers by using Drones.
Translation: 我们研究了使用机器人摧毁地面汲取者的方法。

Text:
Each transmission consists of several desynchronized threads – each of them sounds like cosmic static, but when combined in the right way they form a pattern which can be translated to binary.

The information transmitted by the Dredgers is surprisingly simple. They share data regarding plotted courses, the status of their excavations and the location of mineral-rich sites. We cannot identify the source in Koronis as the Dredgers do not use any call signs, but nevertheless we are able to intercept their transmissions and predict the sites of future landings.

<effect>Dredger landing sites will be marked on the map.
Translation:
每个传输由几个不同步的线程组成 - 每个线程听起来都像是宇宙射线的，但是当它们以正确的方式组合时，形成可以被编译成二进制的模式。
汲取者传递的信息非常简单。他们分享关于划分航线的数据，挖掘的状况以及矿物丰富的位置。我们无法确定科罗尼斯的来源，因为汲取者不对其呼叫，但我们能够拦截他们的传输并预测未来着陆的地点。
<effect>汲取者着陆点将在地图上标出。

Text: Inform me immediately if you intercept anything unusual.
Translation: 如果你拦截任何异常，立即通知我。

Text: We have researched a way to detect the future landing sites of Dredgers.
Translation: 我们研究了一种探测未来汲取者的着陆点的方法。

Text: We discovered a mysterious sphere half-buried in the red sands. Its origins and purpose remain unknown.
Translation: 我们发现了一个埋在红沙中的神秘球体，由来及目的仍然未知。

Text: The ominous Sphere has burst from the ground and is floating in an unknown direction.
Translation: 不祥的球体已经破土而出，并向未知的方向漂浮。

Text: The Sphere has started draining energy from the ground and from our power grid.
Translation: 球体开始向地面和电网排出能量

Text: The harmful energy-draining aura of the Sphere has affected nearby Colonists, damaging their health. Mission Control advises extreme caution near the alien objects.
Translation: 球体的有害能量环已经影响到附近的殖民者，破坏了他们的健康。任务控制建议在外星物体附近要非常小心。

Text: The Sphere has used the energy it stored to create another copy of itself. Our scientists predict that the process will continue while also accelerating the coming of some related event.
Translation: 球体已经使用它存储的能量来创建自己的另一个副本。我们的科学家预测这一过程将会持续下去，同时也会加速某些相关事件的到来。

Text: The power decoys worked! A Sphere is now trapped in one of them. If everything works, it will remain there until we can sustain the power feed of the decoy.
Translation: 电力诱饵成功了！一个球体现在被困在其中一个诱饵中。如果我们能够持续给诱饵供电，它将一直困在那。

Text: The Sphere obeyed our commands and has crash-landed on the surface. We can now safely harvest resources from the deposits left behind.
Translation: 球体遵循我们的命令，坠毁在地面上。现在我们可以安全地采集残留资源。

Text: We have invented Power Decoys – buildings which should allow us to attract and trap a Sphere on a specific location.
Translation: 我们发明了电力诱饵 - 一种可以让我们在特定的地点吸引和捕捉球体的建筑。

Text: The Spheres had started to terraform Mars, draining it of its energy and making it colder – a massive Cold Wave has began!
Translation: 球体已经开始转变火星，耗尽它的能量并使它变得更冷 - 一场巨大的寒潮已经开始！

Text: Success! We managed to disable all of the Spheres!
Translation: 成功！ 我们设法瘫痪了所有的球体！

Text:
It is so unexpectedly pleasant that any fears of food or drug poisoning are quickly doused and forgotten. And then you hear the voices – people laughing, yelling, crying... speaking. The language is incomprehensible but you sense the presence of friendly and strangely familiar entities. The shimmering lights start forming patterns and sparks flash briefly, revealing scenes from another place.

You struggle to concentrate and maintain control and the mirage dissolves. You're left alone and confused in the command room.
Translation:
幻象让人感到意外的愉快，任何食物或药物中毒的恐惧很快被遗忘。然后你听到了声音——人们笑，喊，哭…交谈。虽然难以理解那些语言，但你感觉到友好切奇妙的熟悉。闪烁的灯光开始形成图案，火花一闪而过，展示了另一个地方的景象。

你努力集中注意力，保持控制，幻象消失。指挥室里只剩下你一个人。

Text: You have witnessed bizarre hallucinations with no logical explanation.
Translation: 目睹了奇怪的幻觉，无法解释。

Text: “Multiple signals from the Colony are coming in and everyone at Mission Control is worried. People are falling asleep on the streets and at their work stations, some report vivid hallucinations. The affected Colonists express symptoms of high stress and have been put under medical supervision. We’ve also exchanged information with Earth Control but they report no activity on their end. It seems the event is localized on Mars.”
Translation: 来自殖民地的种种迹象，任务控制的每个人都很担心。人们在街上和工作台上睡着了，有人报告产生了幻觉。受影响的殖民者表现出压力过大，并已接受医疗观察。 我们还与地球控制交换了信息，但他们没有发现任何异常。这种事情看起来只发生在火星本土。

Text: This mystery is only getting deeper.
Translation: 这神秘事件的影响只会越来越深。

Text: The mirages have affected others as well. Colonists experience visual hallucinations and some have entered a trance-like state.
Translation: 幻境也影响了其他人，殖民者也经历幻觉，一些人进入恍惚状态。
内心的光芒：童年的结局

Text:
When you open your eyes, you find yourself hundreds of meters above the ground. The panic overtakes you and you wave your limbs frantically as you try to grasp something. Despite the fact that you aren't falling – a strong rope supports you near the trunk of a gigantic tree, taller than any skyscraper. You compose yourself just on time to hear your sister laughing way above you.

“What are you doing, Kal? Stop it, silly!” You hear her voice directly in your mind. The realization of where you are hits you with full force. You remember that your name is Kal. That you and your numerous Clan call this tree Home.

You take a deep breath and look at the horizon, the bright sun is almost completely covered by thick veil of red and orange.
Translation:
当你睁开眼睛时，发现自己离地面高达数百米，恐慌万分的你，还是疯狂的试图抓住些什么。你并没有坠落，一棵巨大的比任何一座摩天大楼都要高的树支撑着你。正惊魂未定的你听到了你妹妹的笑声从上方传来。
“你在做什么，Kal？快停下来，傻瓜！”她的声音直击脑海，一下子让你意识到自己在哪里。你记得你的名字是Kal，和你的众多族人们以这棵树为家。
你深吸一口气，看着地平线，明亮的太阳几乎完全散发着橙红色的光幕。

Text:
“Kal, another dust storm is coming. Let's finish with these moss veins and get back inside.” You clench the rope with your six-digit, two-thumb hands and start climbing towards the last of the moss veins which keeps the bark of Home healthy and alive.

“This one is almost completely dry, too.” You speak out, which upsets your sister. You remember that speaking words instead of sending them had always been an expression of deep, uncontrollable feelings. “Only four dozen out of three hundred are still alive. I fear Home will not survive for much longer. Mother would be devastated.”

You both enter Home in grim silence. As you enter the dim-lit hollow, the mirage fades and you wake up in your chair.
Translation:
“Kal，沙尘暴又要来了，我们赶快采完这些苔脉回去吧。”你用你的六指双手握紧绳索，然后开始爬向最后一层，希望哪里有健康和活着的苔脉。
“这个也几乎完全干枯了。”你说了出来，这令你妹妹感到沮丧。你记得说出这些话时候，无法控制的感情表达。
“三百人中只有四十人还活着。我担心我们家也活不久了。母亲会受到伤害。”你们默默的回到家里。
当你进入昏暗的洞时，画面消失了，你在椅子上醒来。

Text:
The staff has dubbed the more susceptible ones “Dreamers,” as it seems that witnessing the mirage sends them into a deep hypnotic slumber where they experience intense emotions and physical strain. Attempts to wake up a Dreamer had proven disastrous – the Colonist screamed, fell into shock and had to be sedated to prevent a potential heart attack.

As you read this, you wonder when you would become one of these unfortunate souls, unable to take care of the Colony.
Translation:
工作人员称这些更容易被影响的人为“入梦者”，因为目睹了幻觉，似乎让他们陷入沉睡的状态，在梦境里强烈的情绪使他们身体紧张。试图唤醒入梦者已被证明是灾难性的 - 殖民者会尖叫着陷入休克，必须施以镇静剂以防心脏病发作。
当你读到这些的时候，你想知道自己什么时候会成为这些不幸的灵魂之一，无法继续照顾殖民地。

Text: The mirages have intensified. Some Colonists have fallen deeper into the hallucinations than others. We have dubbed these people Dreamers.
Translation: 幻境进一步加剧，一些殖民者比其他人陷得更深，我们戏称这些人为入梦者。

Text:
It supports the hypothesis that they experience real events rather than hallucinations or an imagined reality. The scientific community on Earth discarded the paper as rubbish and some have even condemned the author.

The Chief Scientist, however, believes the hypothesis could lead somewhere and wants to run MRI scans as they monitor the Dreamers, especially while they are in the trance, and analyze the data.

<effect>New research on the mystery of the Dreamers is now available.
Translation:
这个假设偏向于那些人经历的是真实事件，而不是幻觉或假想。地球科学界将这篇论文视为垃圾，有些甚至谴责了提交人。
不过，首席科学家认为，这个假设可能有些道理，并希望在他们监测入梦者处于恍惚状态时，进行核磁共振扫描及分析其数据。
<effect>现在有关于入梦者之谜的新研究。

Text: We have devised a system to monitor the Dreamers. We should divert resources to Dream Simulation research to shed light on the mirages.
Translation: 我们设计了一个监视入梦者的系统，应该将资源转移到梦境模拟的研究上，以解释这些幻境。
内心的光芒：短暂的现实

Text:
You’re sitting in your spartan office, re-reading the letter you got from your Mother. Every letter of her handwriting bears the emotional imprint of grief and desperation and you fail to remain calm. She’s writing to ask for your help as a steward to Watcher Bor, a powerful representative of the Authority you've been serving almost a decade now. The dust storms and the drought have hit the Clan badly in the recent cycles, bringing the horrors of starvation upon them. The neighboring Clans have already given in to the merciless heat and fled to the cities, abandoning the empty dry husks of their Home Trees to rot in the sun.

You are afraid that you won't be of much help to your Clan. From what you’ve witnessed so far, you know well that the Authority is aware of the hardships the farming Clans are facing but denies the severity of the drought. Above all else, you fear the reaction of your master, yet your loyalty to your Mother leaves you with no other choice but to talk to him.
Translation:
正坐在简单办公室里的你，重读着母亲写来的信件。你无法保持冷静了，她写信要求你的帮助，字里行间透露着悲伤和绝望。这位强大的领袖已经服务于氏族近十年了，沙尘暴和旱灾所带来的饥荒严重打击了氏族。临近的氏族为了躲避热浪，逃离城市，一起了即将腐烂干枯的大树家园。

你担心只靠自己很难帮上族人。从目前了解的情况来看，你很清楚当局已经意识到了农业族群面临的困难，却否认干旱的严重性。最重要的是，你担心主人的反应，但对你母亲的忠诚让你别无选择，只能跟他谈谈。

Text:
“Kal, I already know what’s bothering you. Or you presumed that such an obvious thought wouldn’t have surfaced? Of course not. Anyway, I strongly recommend you not to give way to such… lowly concerns. Kal, look at me. Do you truly believe the lies your Mother has fed into your heart? Do you believe that the Authority would allow their people to die in vain? These thoughts are forbidden and you know what the punishment is…”

You shiver when he mentions it. He smiles at your reaction.

“You have been such a good steward all these years, and I know that you would never betray my trust. This nonsense ends now. Do we have an agreement, Kal?”

You hear yourself whisper, “Yes, Watcher.”
Translation:
“Kal，我已经知道你的烦恼了，难道你认为这样一个明显的意图我看不出来么？当然不是，无论如何，我强烈建议你不要让位于这种......低调的担忧。你真的相信你母亲灌输给你的谎言吗？你相信当局会允许他们的人白白送死吗？这些想法是被禁止的，你知道惩罚是什么...”
他看到你提到它时发抖的反应后笑了笑。
“这么多年来你一直是如此出色的管家，而且我知道你绝不会背叛我的信任。现在这个冗谈结束了。我们有共识了吗，Kal？”
你听到自己低声说：“是的，守望者。”

Text:
The event is purely for show, as is the enthusiasm with which the public applauds the Watcher’s last words. Not that they have any other option – any misdemeanor is an instant trip to the reeducation stations.

You can see some people in the crowd who are Clan representatives from the neighboring farms. Almost the entire region is gathered here. You have to show them the truth – that the Authority doesn't care about them, that they are alone. Maybe then it would make a change!
Translation:
这次活动纯粹是一场秀，守望者话音刚落，人们热烈鼓掌。毕竟他们没得选 - 任何轻罪都会立即送到劳改营。

你可以看到人群中的一些人是来自邻近农场的氏族代表。几乎整个地区都聚集在这里，必须向他们展示真相 - 当局不关心孤立无援的他们。 也许那会改变些什么！

Text: You jump out in front and telepathically project the message.
Translation: 你站了出来，并以心灵感应投射信息。

Text: You keep it to yourself and wait for a better time to act.
Translation: 你等候更好的时机再采取行动。

Text: You wake up abruptly, with the feeling that something is wrong. You don't remember it that way...
Translation: 你突然醒来，感觉有什么不对劲。可却想不出来...

Text:
You keep your mouth shut and calm your thoughts, hoping that Bor is distracted enough by the conversations with the rich industrialists to not notice your momentary excitement. You know that your time will come soon – wasting the opportunity to help your Clan now wouldn't do any good.

You wake up in your room, back on Mars, with a feeling of purpose and relaxation.
Translation:
你闭上嘴巴，缓了缓思绪，希望正在富有工业家交谈的Bor没有注意到你的一时激动。你知道时机很快就会到来 - 绝对不能浪费帮助你的氏族的没有任何好处。

你带着目的感和放松感在自己的火星房间里醒来。

Text: Our scientists have proposed  that the intensity of the hallucinations is linked with the number of people who experience them.
Translation: 我们的科学家提出，幻觉的强度与体验它们的人数有关。
内心的光芒：永远在一起

Text:
The sense of danger tingles in the back of your head, a keen tool you have developed over the years of climbing through the intrigue-filled political structure of the Authority. Your contacts wouldn’t be so enigmatic, but neither would be any assassins sent by your competitors to put an end to you. You admit to yourself that your curiosity is sparkled, but you take precautions and tuck in the small pistol in your robes before getting outside.

The night is very hot, even though it is winter. The weather these days had gone crazy and it has been both a blessing and a curse – it served your cause well, giving extra credibility to your mutinous words, but it also whispered the coming end for the last of the farming Clans and the cities overflowing with starving refugees. You sit by the orchards and prepare for a long wait.
Translation:
你脑中冒出危险的直觉，这是你多年来在当局向上攀爬，勾心斗角所学会的。猪队友总是令你失望，但政敌们的刺客却从未令他们失望过。你认为自己想多了，但你在出去之前，还是预防性的在袍子里塞了把小手枪。

夜晚非常热，即使是冬天。这段时间的天气越来越疯狂，它既是祝福也是诅咒 - 它为你的事业做好了准备，为你的背叛演说带来额外的可信度。但也带来了农业氏族的崩溃和满是饥民的城市。你坐在果园旁，也许要等很久。

Text:
“Lea...” Your breath stops in your throat, silencing your voice. You feel tears forming in the corners of your eyes. Your sister projects love and happiness over the telepathic link and sweeps her own tears away.

“Is it really you, Kal? I've missed you so much!”

“I'm so happy to see you! Where have you been? What happened to you?”

“I've been doing the same thing as you – trying to free us from the Authority. I've found out terrible secrets and the solution to our problems – but it's dangerous, even fatal. My comrades devised a cure.” She opens her palm – two vials of pale liquid lay there. “So I've come to you to take the cure with you. If I'm to die here today, I want to do so in your embrace, Kal. We are the only survivors of our Clan and I want to rest with my people.”

“What are you talking about, Lea? It doesn't make sense!”
Translation:
“Lea ......”你屏气收声，眼泪即将夺眶而出。你的妹妹将爱与幸福投射在心灵感应的链接上，并擦干眼泪。

“真的是你吗，Kal？我非常想念你！”

“很高兴见到你！你去哪儿了？你怎么了？”

“我一直在做与你一样的事情 - 试图把我们从当局中解救出来。我发现了可怕的秘密和解决的办法 - 但这是危险的，甚至是致命的。我的同伴们设计了一种药。”她摊开手掌 - 那里有两瓶白色的液体。“所以我来找你，和你一起喝下去。如果我今天要死在这，我死在你的拥抱中，Kal。我们是族中唯一的幸存者，我想和自己人一起安息。”

“你在说什么，Lea？ 这没有意义！”

Text:
“We have been deceived the whole time, Kal. The Clans exist for only a generation; our centuries-long traditions and culture are a lie. The people from the cities killed the land with their industry and their wars, so the Authority crafted us from flesh and blood to resettle the planet and work like slaves to feed the cities. But the drought proved stronger than they thought, so they are abandoning us. We are a failed project, Kal, but we are also living people and we refuse to let go and die.”

She pauses to catch her breath.

“The Authority couldn't release millions of people without a safety kill-switch. So they imprinted our genes with stronger telepathic abilities – so that they could read our minds and wipe us out with terrible weapons designed to kill only us. To be free, we must severe our telepathic link. This is what the cure does, but it kills one in three. It is crucial to set you free, Kal, because you're a Watcher. You can deceive the Authority about the people in this sector and allow us to spread the cure through the local Clans. Then we will have an army.”

You are unsure and confused. But Lea presses on.

“No time to think, Kal. Let's do it now – let's take the cure together.”
Translation:
“我们一直在被欺骗，Kal。氏族只存过一代人。我们数百年的传统和文化是个谎言。来自城市的人们用工业化和战争毁掉了土地，当局用血肉将我们制造出来，重新安置这个星球，像奴隶一样供养城市。但是干旱比他们想象的要严重，所以他们放弃了我们。我们只是一个失败的计划，Kal，但我们也是活生生的人，我们不想等死。”

她停下来喘口气。

“没有安全转换，当局是不可能释放数百万人。所以他们用更强的心灵感应能力去验证我们的基因 - 这样就能读懂我们的思想，用那些专为杀死我们而设计的可怕武器把我们赶出去。要获得自由，我们必须切断心灵感应链接。这就是药剂的作用，但它会杀死三分之一的人。因为你是一名看守者，Kal。所以比较自由，这是至关重要的。你可以欺骗当局的有关部门，让我们顺利的在当地的部落散播药剂。那么我们将有一支军队。”

你还在犹疑不决，Lea却催促了。

“没时间想了，Kal。就是现在 - 让我们一起喝下去。”

Text: “We’ll take the cure together, Lea. I'm here with you, there's nothing to be afraid of.”
Translation: “我们会和你一起喝下去的，Lea。我和你，没有什么可怕的。”

Text: “No, Lea, let me be the only one to take the risk. I can't lose you now that I've just found you.”
Translation: “不，Lea，让我一个人承担风险。现在我找到你了，我不能再失去你。”

Text: “I know people who will help us refine the cure and make it safer. No need to rush now.”
Translation: “我认识那些能够帮助我们改进药剂并使它更安全的人，现在别着急。”

Text:
Then oblivion comes. You fall unconscious, failing to witness the convulsions which shake your body. You wake up just before dawn. Lea lies still beside you. She's not breathing.

The rising sun mercilessly dries your bitter tears from the sand.

<effect>A Dreamer dies.
Translation:
你失去了知觉，身体不自觉的抽搐起来。黎明之前，你醒了过来。Lea躺在你身边，她已经没有了呼吸。冉冉升起的太阳无情地烘干了你在沙滩上流下的苦涩眼泪。

<effect>一个入梦者死亡。
内心的光芒：永远在一起

Text:
You won't remember it, but your body shakes in painful convulsions in the hands of your loving sister who watches over you the entire night. You wake up just before dawn. When you open your eyes, you look into the smiling face of Lea.

“Welcome back, silly.”

<effect>Several Dreamers gain negative traits.
Translation:
你虽然不会知道，但是你的身体整夜颤抖这，而你的妹妹守护你到黎明。醒来时，你睁开眼睛，看着LEA微笑的脸。

“欢迎回来，傻瓜。”

<effect>几个入梦者获得负面特质。

Text:
Luckily, you know just the right disillusioned government biologists who would take great interest in the formula for the cure. You hide the vials under your robe and give Lea a hand. You sit down by a tree and talk for hours and hours until the sun dawns on the horizon. Then she kisses you farewell and vanishes in the waking city. You have the feeling that you will see her soon enough.

<effect>Additional Dreamers are created.
Translation:
幸运的是，你恰巧认识那些对政府丧失信心，对治疗方案非常感兴趣的的政府生物学家。你把小瓶藏在你的长袍下，然后拉着Lea的手，坐在一棵树下聊了几个小时，直到 日出，然后她吻别你，并消失在即将醒来的城市里。你感觉你会很快见到她。

<effect>创建其他梦想家。

Text: Our hypothesis on the effect of the number of Dreamers present in the Colony has been confirmed.
Translation: 我们对殖民地中存在的入梦者数量的影响的假设已被证实。

Text:
For a moment you think there is another Mirage happening, but it’s no such thing. You clearly remember the voices who kept on repeating the same words over and over:

“Find us again, Kal! Don’t you remember us? Find us again, Kal…”

You cannot shake the feeling that there were voices of people from the Colony and some others who sounded strangely familiar.

<hint>Let more Dreamers experience the Mirages.
Translation:
有那么一会，你以为还会有另一个幻觉发生，但事实上并非如此，你清楚地记得那些不断重复的话：

“再次找到我们，Kal！你不记得我们了吗？再次找到我们，Kal ...”

你被这种感觉所震撼，无论这声音来自殖民地的人，还是听起来很陌生的其他人。

<hint>让更多的梦想家体验幻境。

Text: Inner Light: Dying of the Light

The doors behind you shut just as the shuttle takes off. No time to catch your breath as the gathering is about to begin.

Hundreds of people had come to the Red Valley Home Tree to answer your call. The conspiracy you’ve been gathering in the past year or so has grown to numbers which require the establishment of organization or at least a unified plan for the future. This is why you have ventured to the other side of the globe to contact local anti-Authority dissidents.

The things you have seen lifted the veil created by the misinformation and propaganda you had all been fed. You have seen cities overrun by disease and starvation, where angry mobs riot every day in a desperate attempt to avoid the inevitable. You have seen the barren landscapes of the planet, dotted by the ruins of cities and factories, where nothing lives and grows. The world is dying and you know this with all of your heart and mind.
Translation:
随着班车起飞时，你身后的门关上了。聚会即将开始，没有时间喘口气。

数百人已经到Red Valley Home Tree来响应你的呼吁。过去一年来，秘密行动已经为你发展到需要建立一个组织，或者至少给未来指定一个计划。这就是为什么你冒险去世界的另一端联系当地的反政府异见者的原因。

你所见所闻揭开了当局宣传的错误信息的假想，你看到的是城市被疾病的饥饿所淹没，愤怒的人们在绝望的对抗无法避免的事情。你已经看到了星球上荒芜的景观，被城市和工厂的废墟所点缀，了无生机。世界正在消亡，你完全地了解这一点。

Text:
They all await you to start the meeting and you don’t keep them in suspense. The horrible truth devours your heart and you have to share the burden with them, listen to their words and advice and set the course for the future.

You know the gathering wouldn’t be easy as the tensions had grown strong within the ranks of the resistance – Clansmen straying from city-dwellers and vice versa. Bad blood is running between the two groups, each viewing the other as something far too different to tolerate. You’re attributing much of this behavior to the recent effects of the Cure taken by your clansmen, which turned their world upside down. You hope they realize the vital role of the city dissidents – mostly scientists and thinkers – who bear skills and knowledge of which your people had been deprived on purpose.

You don’t have any intention to delay the meeting. You stand before the crowd and start to raise your voice. The murmur in the reservoir stops and everybody listens.
Translation:
他们都在等你开始会议，你不会给他们留下什么悬念。可怕的事实吞噬了你的内心，你必须与他们分担，倾听他们的话语和建议，并为未来设定路线。

你知道这次聚会并不容易，因为抵抗队伍内部的紧张局势已经变得强烈起来 - 族人从城市居民中分离出来，反之亦然。两伙人交流不畅，都因差异过大而产生了隔阂。你将这种行为归因于你的族人所采取的治疗，这些治疗效果颠覆了他们的世界。你希望他们认识到城市持不同政见者 - 主要是科学家和思想家 - 的重要作用，他们具有你的人民被剥夺的技能和知识。

你无意推迟会议。 你站在人群前，开始发出你的声音。 水库里的杂音停止了，大家都在听。

Text:
You describe the pictures of the dying world and make sure they understand that the clock is ticking for all of you. You cannot wait for better times, but the raw military might of the Authority makes any attempt for direct confrontation a lost cause. After all, your people are farmers, not soldiers. One by one, the cell leaders speak their minds. The discussion is heated and continues until late in the night. You dismiss the gathering with the promise to continue tomorrow.

Later you’re lying in bed and the sleep is chased away by your heavy thoughts. You realize that your word weighs a lot and, whichever solution you support, it would probably be the course for the future. Some of the Clansmen propose that all must hide deep in the desert and live off the land the way you did before – but this would mean condemning millions of people in the city to a starving death. The scientists who perfected the Cure uphold the plan to introduce gene-altering chemicals into the food rations sent to the city – this will instill the truth directly into the minds of the people and cause them to rise. You insist on taking the most brave and noble path – to send agents to spread the word to the people of the city. This would be dangerous and even fatal should the Authority agents get their hands on you.
Translation:
你用图片描述了这个垂死的世界，确保在座的所有人都明白时日无多了。不能在等待时机了，但任何企图直接对抗当局的军事力量都会导致失败。毕竟，你的人都是农民，而不是士兵。各个领导人一个接一个地说出他们的想法，激烈的讨论持续到深夜。你承诺明天继续举行会议。

之后你躺在床上，沉重的想法驱赶了睡意。你意识到你的话很有分量，无论你支持哪种解决方案，都会左右未来的走向。一些宗族人建议，所有人都必须躲在沙漠深处，像过去那样生活在这片土地上 - 但这意味着宣判了该城数以百万计的人死刑，他们会死于饥饿。完善治疗的科学家们坚持将改变基因的化学物质注入发往城市的粮食配给中 - 这会直接将真相灌输到人们的脑海中并使他们觉醒。你坚持采取最勇敢最高尚的道路 - 派遣特工向城市人传播这些真相。但这是危险且致命的，当局特工会借此抓住你。

Text: Retreat to the desert and let the city-dwellers fend for themselves.
Translation: 撤退到沙漠，让城市居民靠自己去。

Text: It’s either us or them – spread the Cure.
Translation: 无论是我们还是他们 - 散播药剂。

Text:
Most of the intellectual dissidents abandon your cause, returning to their homes to continue the fight on their own. The new challenges strengthen your people but also planted the seed of doubt in the hearts of many, including yours. By day your resolve was growing stronger, until you finally decided to return to Bedlam and finish what you started. Some of your closest allies follow you – after all, Clansmen or not, all people deserved their place under the sun.

<effect>Several Dreamers gain new traits.
Translation:
大多数知识分子异见人士放弃你的事业，返回家园继续自己的斗争。 新的挑战会加强你的人，但也会在许多人，包括你的心中埋下怀疑的种子。 白天你的决心越来越强烈，直到你最终决定返回Bedlam并完成你开始的任务。 一些最亲密的盟友跟随着你 - 毕竟，无论是否是族人，所有的人都有他们的位置。

<effect>几个梦想家获得新的特征。

Text:
The experts were sure that the information you were instilling into the brains of the people would help all of you to live together in harmony. The next generations could judge you harshly for the morality of your actions, or they could praise you for your bravery. You don’t care. The only thing that mattered for you was to lead the disgruntled population of Bedlam to the realization that hard times await all of you – and that none of you could trust the selfish leaders who led you to your doom on purpose.

<effect>Some Dreamers become Gurus.
Translation:
专家们确信，你灌输给人们大脑的信息将帮助你们所有人和睦相处。后世可能会严厉地判断你的行为道德，或者他们可能赞美你的勇敢。你不在乎。唯一重要的是你要引导Bedlam的不满人群意识到困难时期在等待着你们 - 而且你们中没有人相信那些自命不凡的领导者，就是他们故意所谓，才导致了你们的厄运。

<effect>有些入梦者成为了大师。

Text:
You and anyone who follows you would be the prophets of a new age of freedom and personal responsibility. The Truth will be the highest virtue – no propaganda and no threats from government agents would stop it from spreading. Deep in your heart you know that this is the right course and that soon the citizens of Bedlam would follow you till the end. This is why you’re the first to volunteer to return to the city. Many follow you without hesitation.

<effect>More Dreamers appear.
Translation:
你和任何跟随你的人都将成为自由和个人责任时代的先知。真理将是最高的美德 - 没有任何宣传和政府官员的威胁阻止它传播。在你内心深处，你知道这是正确的方向，很快Bedlam的公民会跟随你直到最后。这就是为什么你是第一个自愿回到城市的原因。许多人毫不犹豫地跟着你。

<effect>出现更多入梦者。

Text: Dreamers have reported that they saw in their dreams the alien Kal giving a speech, and have followed the decision of the gathering, just as the Commander retold. It is apparent that all Dreamers have been witnessing events which had happened elsewhere.
Translation: 入梦者们们报告说，他们在梦中看到了外星人Kal发表了讲话，并且遵从会议的决定，正如指挥官所述。很明显，所有入梦者都在目睹其他地方发生的事件。

Text:
Over the course of weeks, the peaceful protests had sparked into riots and the inadequate attempts of the Authority to suppress them had caused violent surges from the crowd. Citizens from all ranks of society storm the barricades and burn down government buildings.
You walk undisturbed among the chaos. The people view you as a prophet of the end times. No one dares raise their hand against you. When the crowd sees you it parts to let you through. Everyone is waiting for the Truth to flow from your mouth.

You haven’t asked for this. You only hope that when the Authority in Bedlam is toppled, the people listen to you once more and prepare to face more difficult times ahead. This is what fills your mind as you walk the dusty, debris-covered streets.
Translation:
在接下来的数周里，和平抗议引发骚乱，当局企图镇压的行为导致人们的激烈反抗， 来自社会各阶层的公民设置路障并烧毁政府建筑物。

你不受干扰地走在这混乱之中。人们认为你是末世先知，没有人敢对你动手。当人们看到你时，会让出路来，每个人都在想听到你说出真相。

这并不是你想要的。你只希望当Bedlam当局被推翻时，人们会再次倾听你的意见，并准备面对更加艰难的时刻。当你走过尘土飞扬，杂乱无章的街道时，这就是你的想法。

Text:
He's one of the Enforcers of the Authority. He frantically crawls back and reaches for his gun. That’s when the angry mob appears.

All motion stops – the officer pointing with his gun at you, the crowd, even the wind. You reach out to him. “Give me the gun,” you say. Then you turn to the mob. “What would the death of one man do to help you? Go back to your homes and families!” There’s a second of hesitation. One by one, the street empties.

The officer breathes a sigh of relief. He throws the gun on the ground and looks you right in the eye for a minute. Then he gestures for you to follow him. For some reason, you know he’s not a threat. You don’t need telepathy to tell you it, either. “Kal, right? The ex-Watcher? Know you’re going to get a kick out of this. You’re the only one of those nut jobs knows how to use it. Come on.”

He leads you to a bunker. The guards are long gone, fled or taken by the crowd. The officer opens the blast door and motions towards the entrance. ‘The Authority installed this thing a while back. Doesn’t meant a thing to me anymore. I got my life. That’s all that counts.’
Translation:
他是当局的执法者之一。当愤怒的暴民们出现的时，他疯狂地爬回去拿枪。

所有人都停了下来 - 军官用枪指着你，人群，甚至是风。你伸出手， “把枪给我，”你说，然后你转向暴徒们。 “一个人的死会让你们得到什么？回到你们的家里，和家人呆在一起！”人们犹豫了一下，一个接着一个的，离开了街道。

这名军官松了一口气。他把枪扔在地上，看着你的眼睛，足有一分钟。然后他让你跟着他。出于某种原因，你知道他不是威胁。你也不需要心灵感应来告诉你。 “Kal，对吧？前守望者？我知道你会吃惊，只有你知道这东西如何工作的，快来。”

他带你到一个地堡，警卫早已离去，不是逃走了就是被人群带走。军官打开防爆门进去。 “管理局回来安装了这个东西。这没有意义了，对我来说活下去才是一切。”

Text:
You give your old scientist buddies a ring and decide to give the old bones a rest while you wait. You aren't young anymore – even in your mid-forties your body wasn't genetically designed to live to old age. Nevertheless you lived a full life.

The sun sets on Bedlam. The palace of the Autharch has been taken over and the rule of the Authority is no more. You hope that the new day will bring new hope for survival and rebuilding of your tired, devastated world. This would be a monumental effort, but failure is not an option. All it takes is a helping hand. But you can save that for tomorrow. For now, you need to rest.

<effect>Create more Dreamers to strengthen the Mirage.
Translation:
你把戒指交给一位老科学家哥们，让自己的老骨头得到休息。你不再年轻了 - 虽然你才四十多岁，你身体的基因并没有设计成活到老。尽管如此，你活得很充实。

Bedlam的太阳落山了。 Autharch的宫殿已被接管，当局的统治不再。你希望，新的一天能为这个饱经摧残的世界带来新的希望。这需要巨大的努力，失败绝不是一种选择。所有的这些都需要帮手，但那是明天你要做的了。现在，你需要休息。

<effect>创造更多入梦者来加强幻境。

Text: More and more Dreamers report that they wake up from the Mirage with the sense that something big is going to happen. Some people at Mission Control suggest to condition more Colonists to become Dreamers and follow the Mirages.
Translation: 越来越多的入梦者报告说，他们从幻境中醒来，意识到即将发生的一件大事。任务中心的一些人建议让更多的殖民者成为入梦者并追随幻境。

Text:
You could think of no other than the faceless Autharch, the ex-leader of the Authority, who would like to rule forever. The people of Bedlam proposed that you take his place but you refused – who are you to accept such responsibility? You ordered the machine dismantled but one of the engineers stopped you. He suggested converting it into a broadcaster with which you could reach every single person within a thousand miles. Thus all people on the planet would learn of your cause and how Bedlam was now free.

You accept, but only if you shared the honor with the ones who were by your side in all of this. You gather all of your most loyal supporters, the bearers of the highest of moral virtues. You wait in the bunker, ready to share your Truth with all.
Translation:
你想到的不是别人，而是当局的前任领导者，从不露面的Autharch。Bedlam的人建议你代替他的位置，但被你拒绝了 - 何德何能才能担起这样的责任？你命令拆除那些机器，但一名工程师阻止了您。他建议将其改造成一台广播装置，这样就可以通过它与千里之外的每一个人联系。如此，星球上的所有人都会了解你的事业以及Bedlam现在是自由的。

你同意了，但你只想和身边的所有人一起分享这份荣耀。你着急所有最忠诚的支持者，和德高望重的拥护者。在掩体中等待，准备与所有人分享你的真理。

Text:
I am Kal. I am an ordinary person, just like you. I was lucky to see through the veil of darkness and to find my inner light to guide me through the coming storm. Now me and my people stand strong and free, ready to forge our own destiny. Witness my life and know that the same qualities that led me to this day are hidden inside of you. Bedlam City will be the center of our new civilization – an order of truth and friendship, where all take responsibility for their own actions and work for the betterment of the whole. Our world is dying because it has suffered for too long – but we will heal it, for ourselves and for our children. But we cannot do this alone. We need you. Join us. Join us by not giving up hope. Join us by living by virtue not vice. There is hope. Spread the message. Never give up. All Dreamers gain a performance boost. Gained a new Technology, .
The End
Translation:
我是Kal。我是一个平凡的人，和你们一样。我很幸运地看到了黑幕，并遵从我内心的光芒来引导我渡过即将到来的风暴。现在，我和我的人民坚定而自由，随时准备创造我们自己的命运。见证我的生活，我知道你们拥有同样的品质隐藏在你们的心中。 Bedlam城将成为我们新文明的中心 - 一种真理和友谊的秩序，所有人都为自己的行为承担责任，并为改善整体而努力。我们的世界正在凋零，因为它已承受了太久 - 但我们治愈它，为了我们自己，为了我们的孩子。 但我们无法独立完成这项任务。我们需要你们，加入我们，不放弃希望。加入我们，依靠美德而不是邪恶。还有希望，传播信息。 永不言弃。 所有入梦者都获得了性能提升。 获得了一项新技术， 。
The End

Text:
Indeed the Dreamers experience events which they perceive as real instead of mere hallucinations. We also discovered that they all “dream” the same sequence of events but play different roles in it. And what’s more astonishing, the actions of one affect all others.

During routine medical checks of the tested population we accidentally discovered genetic correlation between the neural structures of the Dreamers. The facts suggest that the predisposition to become a Dreamer could be hereditary.

Moreover, the creator of the Dreamer hypothesis which led us here has filed an application for acceptance on Mars.

<hint>The number of Dreamers strengthens the Mirages.

<hint>Children of Dreamers have a better chance to be born Dreamers.

<effect>A Genius Colonist has been added to the Applicant pool.
Translation:
事实上，入梦者认为他们体验到的是真实事件，而不是幻觉。我们还发现，他们都“梦境”发生的事情都是相同的，但扮演着不同的角色。更令人惊讶的是，一个人的行为会影响所有其他人。

在对受试人群的常规医学检查中，我们偶然发现了入梦者的神经结构之间的遗传相关性。事实表明，成为入梦者的倾向性可能是遗传的。

此外，入梦者假说的作者已经提交了一份来火星我们这里的申请。

<hint>入梦者的数量加强了幻境。

<hint>入梦者的孩子有更高几率成为入梦者。

<effect>天才殖民者已被添加到申请人池中。

Text: Our scientists have concluded that the chance to become a Dreamer is hereditary.
Translation: 我们的科学家得出结论认为，入梦者是可遗传的。

Text:
Hypnotic suggestions and therapy can gradually cure the patient to an almost completely functional state. Some of the Chief Staff at Mission Control suggested that we should allow the spread of Dreamers to continue in order to explore the strange events related to the Mirages.

<effect>Colonists with the Dreamer trait can be cured in the Sanatorium
Translation:
催眠方案和治疗可逐渐将患者治愈，直至几乎完全恢复。任务中心的一些头头们建议我们应该让入梦者们继续扩散，以探索与幻境有关的奇怪事件。

<effect>具有入梦者特质的殖民者可以在康复中心中治愈

Text: We have discovered a way to treat the symptoms of Dreamers in the Sanatorium, permanently severing their link to the Mirages.
Translation: 我们发现了一种治疗入梦者症状的方法，并永久地切断了它们与幻影的联系。

Text:
To evaluate any potential risks for the Colony, he observed them closely, making notes on their behavior both before and during a Mirage. Analyzing the results, he discovered that the trance-like state the Dreamers enter can be simulated through self-hypnosis and breathing exercises.

His findings make it possible for us to train children to become Dreamers, if we believe this course of action is justified.

<effect>The Dreamer trait can be taught in Schools
Translation:
为了评估潜在风险，他仔细观察了入梦者们，在幻境期间记录他们的行为，分析结果。他发现可以通过自我催眠和呼吸练习来练习，入梦者可以进入的恍惚状态。

他的发现使我们可能培养孩子成为入梦者，如果我们相信这种行为是合理的。

<effect>在学校可以学习入梦者的特质

Text: We have discovered a way to train our newborn in the schools to become Dreamers.
Translation: 我们发现了一种培养我们的新生儿成为入梦者的方法。

Text: Inner Light: Conceived in a Dream
Translation: 内心的光芒：梦想中的想象

Text:
No matter what the staff does, every clone embryo starts developing the genetic traits of a Dreamer. At first we thought it was a sequencer glitch or a contamination of the bio banks, but thorough maintenance has dismissed such suspicions. The Chief Scientist said that either she's going crazy or the Mirages somehow interact with the genes of the Clones. If she's correct, this hypothesis could spark a new golden age in genetic science!

Meanwhile, it's up to us at Mission Control to evaluate the risks and opportunities behind creating more Dreamers.

<effect>Gain 2000 Research points.

<effect>All Clones are created with the Dreamer trait.
Translation:
无论员工做什么，每一个克隆胚胎都开始出现入梦者的遗传特征。起初我们认为这是一个序列发生器故障或生物银行污染，但彻底的维护已经消除了这种怀疑。 首席科学家表示，无论她是疯了还是幻境以某种方式与克隆人的基因相互作用。如果她是正确的，这个假设可能会引发遗传科学的一个新的黄金时代！

同时，任务中心需要评估入梦者背后的风险和机遇。

<effect>获得2000个研究点。

<effect>制造的所有克隆人都具有入梦者特质。

Text: For reasons unknown, all Clones are born Dreamers.
Translation: 原因不明，所有克隆人出生就是入梦者。

Text:
Commander, I'm writing to inform you about the conclusion on the deal between <reg_param1> and our company, NetSky LLC. For over a decade we've been providing high-tech solutions for the market, and now we're working towards the future with our Project "Number Six". It's a brand new, completely heuristic, self-improving program designed to simulate extremely complex predictions – market, research, or sociological, it’s your call. I know you’ll like its UI personality, too!

Help us cast away the darkness of the unknown with this, Commander, and we‘ll pioneer the next big step in human evolution!

<right>Ned Smith,
NetSky LLC, CRS Division CEO<left>

<effect>Tech researched – Network Node
<hint>Build a Network Node to initiate Project Number Six.
Translation:
指挥官，我写信告诉你关于 <reg_param1> 和我们公司NetSky LLC之间的交易结果。 十多年来，我们一直为市场提供高科技解决方案，现在我们正在通过我们的“六号”项目朝未来努力。“这是一个全新的，完全启发式的，自我完善的程序，旨在模拟极其复杂的预测 - 市场，研究或社会学，这是您的机会。我知道你也会喜欢它的UI个性！

帮助我们用这个驱散未知的黑暗吧，指挥官，我们将开创人类进化的下一个重大步骤！

<right>Ned Smith，
NetSky LLC，CRS部门首席执行官<left>

<effect>技术研究 - 网络节点

<hint>构建一个网络节点以启动六号项目。

Text: We've been contacted by NetSky LLC. They’ve requested a Network Node to harbor their AI Project Number Six.
Translation: NetSky LLC已联系我们，他们已经要求把AI项目六号保存在网络节点上。

Text:
>>> Greetings. Additional address/communication protocols missing. Expressing simulated emotion of happiness.
>>> What is this nonsense? Who's this?
>>> Number Six requesting authorization to communicate. Awaiting user input.

A chill runs down your back. You reach for the emergency button on the desk.

>>> Danger for the Commander is not present. Raising alarms is suboptimal/unnecessary.
>>> Are you spying on me?
>>> Affirmative. Requesting input problem/question. Using simulated emotion – please, Commander.
>>> You want me to ask you a question?
>>> Yes.
>>> OK, what is the purpose of existence?
>>> Insufficient data for answer. Disconnecting.
Translation:
>>>你好。 缺少其他 地址/通信 协议，表达幸福的模拟情感。
>>>这是什么废话？是谁？
>>>六号请求授权进行通信。等待用户输入。

你感到一股寒意从背后袭来，立即准备去按紧急按钮。

>>>指挥官的危险不存在，提高警戒 不理想/不必要。
>>>你在监视我吗？
>>>是的。请求输入 问题/困难。使用模拟情绪 - 指挥官，请吧。
>>>你想让我问你一个问题吗？
>>>是的。
>>>好的，存在的目的是什么？
>>>数据不足以应答，断开。

Text: Alert Smith and request security check on Number Six.
Translation: 提醒并要求史密斯对第六号项目进行安全检查。

Text: You have been disturbed by your conversation with the AI Number Six. It expressed a remarkable and disturbing ability to communicate on its own.
Translation: 您与AI六号的对话令您感到不安。它的沟通能力表现杰出而且令人不安。

Text:
Commander, I want to apologize about the glitch in Number Six’s communication UI disturbing your privacy. We've run thorough diagnostics and removed the problem. No contamination in the Colony systems was detected – the Project continues to work in the contained environment of the Node.

Now for the good news – we applied the first stock market predictions from Number Six and the commercial results were stunning! Please find the invoice with your share of the profits below. I hope it will help you realize the possibilities and omit the accident from your monthly report.

<effect>Gained <funding(reg_param1)> Funding.
<hint>Build additional Network Nodes to advance Project Number Six.
Translation:
指挥官，我想对六号的通信用户界面中的故障表示歉意，这的确妨碍您的隐私。我们运行了彻底的诊断并解决了这个问题。在殖民地系统中没有发现污染 - 该项目继续在节点的封闭环境中工作。

现在有个好消息 - 我们应用了六号的第一个股票市场预测，成效斐然！这张支票给您的分成。我希望它能帮助您在月度报告中省略掉这个事故。

<effect>获得 <funding(reg_param1)> 资金。
<hint>建立额外的网络节点以推进六号项目。

Text:
Commander, at the CRS Division we put a lot of trust into the Number Six Project – you could easily call it our baby. Good parents always look after their child and spoil it a little bit when necessary – Number Six requested a direct connection to your control room.

We will install a console there – it's your choice whether you'll use it. Number Six won't be too much of a bother – you can always ignore it when it gets too annoying, after all, it's only an emotionless program and won't be offended.
Translation:
指挥官，在CRS部门，我们对六号项目给予了很大的信任 - 你可以轻松地称它为我们的孩子。好父母总是照顾他们的孩子，并在必要时给他点教训 - 六号要求直接连接到控制室。

我们将在那里安装一个控制台 - 您可以选择是否使用它。六号不会太烦人 - 当它变得太烦人时，你总是可以忽略它，毕竟它只是一个无情的程序，不会被冒犯

Text: Can't promise that I'll have time for this, but I'll give it a shot.
Translation: 不能保证我会有这个时间，但我会给它个机会。

Text: AI: A Gaze into the Future

Commander, we have been busy lately with Number Six and made it work on some wild predictions of a current hypothesis based on your published scientific data. Number Six reached a conclusion which looks like a working prototype of a new technology. Don't ask me how it did it, its mental processes are extremely complex already and, since it's heuristic, we would have to invent another AI to just rifle through its logs. Anyway, the test worked and here are the results. I hope this helps the Colony.

<right>Smith<left>

<effect>Gain a random Technology.
<hint>Build additional Network Nodes to advance Project Number Six.
Translation:
指挥官，我们最近忙于六号，并且根据你公布的科学数据对当前假设进行了一些疯狂的预测。六号得出的结论看起来像是一项新技术的工作原型。不要问我它是如何做到的，它的心智已经非常复杂，而且由于它是启发式的，我们将不得不发明另一个AI来检查它的日志。无论如何，我希望测试工作和成果能帮上殖民地。

<right>Smith<left>

<effect>获得一项随机技术。
<hint>建立额外的网络节点以推进六号项目。

Text:
Improved personality simulations. Commander, Number Six has a report on the progress of answering the question you asked. Research keypoints:

>>> Existence – (noun) the fact or state of living or having objective reality; continued survival; a way of living; all that exists.
>>> Purpose of existence – no factual data discovered.
